item.title: Heavy Rains Likely In Tamil Nadu As Low Pressure Area Expected To Form In Bay Of Bengal Today - News18
item.description:
Heavy Rains Likely In Tamil Nadu As Low Pressure Area Expected To Form In Bay Of Bengal Today

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18 Tamil

The Indian Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert for very heavy rain in four districts of Tamil Nadu as a low-pressure area is expected to form in the Bay of Bengal.

  • An orange alert has been issued for Nagapattinam, Thiruvarur, Mayiladuthurai, and Cuddalore districts.
  • Heavy rain is also expected in Thanjavur, Ariyalur, Perambalur, Pudukkottai, Tiruchirappalli, Kallakurichi, Villupuram, Chengalpattu districts, and Puducherry.
  • Moderate rain is likely to continue in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.
  • Fishermen are advised against venturing into the coastal areas due to expected gusts of wind up to 55 km/h.
The Meteorological Department has stated that the low-pressure area is likely to strengthen and move towards Tamil Nadu in a west-northwesterly direction.

This weather event is expected to have significant impacts on the region, especially considering the potential for widespread rainfall and advisories issued for safety.

item.title: Why NSA Ajit Doval’s China Visit Is Key: Exclusive On December 18 Talks - News18
item.description:
NSA Ajit Doval’s Upcoming China Visit: Key Talks on December 18

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is set to visit China for Special Representative (SR) talks on December 18, focusing on LAC disengagement amidst hope for meaningful dialogue to prevent incidents similar to Galwan.

  • The visit is part of ongoing negotiations following the eastern Ladakh military standoff that began in May 2020.
  • Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will represent China during the talks.
  • The discussions aim to clarify the Line of Actual Control (LAC) and resolve operational issues to prevent further confrontations.
  • Expectations are hopeful for achieving significant progress and defining timelines for future meetings.
“We are hopeful to have meaningful dialogue with China for further engagement and to avoid a Galwan-like incident,” said government sources.

This visit could be crucial for stabilizing relations and defining clear operational boundaries in the ongoing India-China dialogue.

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

  • BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra termed the opposition INDIA bloc as a "scam'' due to its divided leadership.

item.title: Delhi High Court summons SpiceJet CEO, COO over non-payment of $6 million to lessors - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi High Court Summons SpiceJet Executives Over $6 Million Payment Issue

Published on: 16 Dec 2024, 11:26 am

The Delhi High Court has summoned the CEO and COO of SpiceJet to appear in court over a non-payment of $6.03 million due to lessors. The court specified that video conferencing was not an option for their appearance.

  • The court directed SpiceJet executives to appear on January 16, 2025.
  • Engine lessors have initiated legal action against SpiceJet for non-payment.
  • SpiceJet defaulted on a prior agreement to pay $4.8 million in installments.
  • The court has ordered SpiceJet to ground three engines and return them to lessors.
"It is made clear that the request of the counsel for Judgement Debtor (SpiceJet) for appearance of the aforesaid officers through Video Conferencing has been specifically denied."

This order emphasizes the seriousness of SpiceJet's financial issues and its obligations to the lessors as it faces multiple legal challenges.

item.title: Supreme Court Weekly Round-up: December 9, 2024 To December 15, 2024 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Weekly Round-up: December 9, 2024 To December 15, 2024

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 Source: LiveLaw

This week, the Supreme Court delivered several important judgments across a range of legal issues, including interpretations of the Indian Penal Code, property rights under Hindu law, and the responsibilities under various legal provisions.

  • Kunhimuhammed v. State of Kerala: Conviction for murder upheld, emphasizing intention irrelevant if serious injury is inflicted.
  • NHAI v. G Athipathi: Rejection of promotion claim based on deputation; continuity of service questioned.
  • Tej Bhan v. Ram Kishan: Referring conflicting opinions on rights of female Hindus under Hindu Succession Act.
  • Leela Agrawal v. Sarkar: Clarification on mortgage transactions and possession rights.
  • Dara Lakshmi Narayana v. State of Telangana: Warning against misuse of IPC Section 498A in domestic disputes.
  • Parvin Kumar Jain v. Anju Jain: Permanent alimony set at Rs. 5 Crores; emphasis on the obligation to provide for children.
“The right to maintenance is commensurate to the right to sustenance...” - Supreme Court

As these cases reflect significant judicial interpretations, they have far-reaching implications for legal standards and societal norms in India.

item.title: ‘How is that an offence?’: SC asks in case over ‘Jai Shri Ram’ slogans in Karnataka mosque - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘How is that an offence?’: SC asks in case over ‘Jai Shri Ram’ slogans in Karnataka mosque

Publication Date: December 2024; Source: Indian Express

The Supreme Court has queried whether shouting 'Jai Shri Ram' slogans in a mosque qualifies as a legal offence and has requested the Karnataka government to respond regarding an appeal linked to this case.

  • The Supreme Court reviewed an appeal challenging a Karnataka High Court decision quashing a case against two individuals accused of raising the slogans.
  • Justice Sandeep Mehta of the Supreme Court questioned the basis of labeling the slogan as an offence.
  • Senior Advocate Devadatt Kamat stated that such actions could promote religious enmity, which is punishable under the IPC.
  • The incident occurred in September 2023 at Badriya Jumma Masjid when two individuals allegedly shouted slogans before fleeing.
  • The Karnataka High Court previously ruled that the allegations did not meet the criteria for the offences alleged.
“Alright, they were shouting a particular religious slogan. How is that an offence?” - Justice Sandeep Mehta

The case raises important questions about religious expression and legal constraints in India, reflecting ongoing societal debates regarding freedom of speech versus communal harmony.

item.title: GRAP III restrictions back in Delhi as air quality dips; schools to go hybrid for up to class V - The Hindu
item.description:
Air Quality Deteriorates in Delhi: GRAP III Restrictions Implemented and Schools Transition to Hybrid Learning

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 - Source: The Hindu

The Central air quality panel has enacted Stage III of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) due to a significant decline in air quality in Delhi-NCR. As part of this, schools will transition to hybrid learning for students up to Class V.

  • Delhi’s Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 367, marking a severe drop.
  • Stage III mandates that students learn in a hybrid format, balancing online and in-person classes.
  • The rules include a ban on non-essential diesel-operated vehicles of older standards within Delhi.
  • Exemptions apply for persons with disabilities regarding certain vehicle restrictions.
  • Digression of timings for public offices may also be implemented to manage traffic and air quality.
“Considering the highly unfavourable meteorological conditions… the panel’s sub-committee on Graded Response Action Plan decides to impose stage 3 of the revised GRAP schedule… with immediate effect,”

In conclusion, these measures aim to mitigate the effects of poor air quality in Delhi and its neighboring regions during the winter months.

item.title: Those Who Give Money To Beggars Will Face Police Case In This City - NDTV
item.description:
Those Who Give Money To Beggars Will Face Police Case In This City

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

Indore, known as India's cleanest city, is launching a new initiative to eliminate begging by threatening legal action against those who give money to beggars. Starting January 1, FIRs will be filed against anyone caught giving alms.

  • The district administration aims to register FIRs against anyone giving money to beggars.
  • A ban on begging has already been issued in Indore.
  • The initiative is part of a central government pilot project involving ten cities.

“I appeal to all residents of Indore not to become partners in the sin by giving alms to people.” - Ashish Singh, District Collector

This initiative highlights the city's commitment to addressing the issue of begging through strict enforcement and rehabilitation measures.

item.title: How Supreme Court's Judgment In Nestle Case Is Linked To Switzerland Revoking India's MFN Status - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
How Supreme Court's Judgment In Nestle Case Is Linked To Switzerland Revoking India's MFN Status

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Last week, Switzerland decided to revoke the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) treatment for India starting January 1, 2025, based on a Supreme Court ruling related to a tax dispute involving Nestle.

  • Switzerland claims its decision follows a 2023 Supreme Court judgment regarding Double Taxation Avoidance Agreement.
  • The ruling states that DTAA cannot be enforced unless notified by India's Central Government under Section 90 of the Income Tax Act.
  • The court emphasizes that a treaty with a third country benefiting from OECD membership requires explicit notification to amend tax benefits.
  • Companies like Nestle, Steria India, and others challenged this in hopes of gaining FMN rights based on their existing DTAAs.
“Absent this step, treaties and protocols are per se unenforceable,” the Supreme Court concluded.

This ruling has significant implications for India's international tax agreements and could affect foreign businesses operating in India.

item.title: Wrong Practice Of Converting Civil Disputes Into Criminal Cases Rampant In Many States : Supreme Court - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Wrong Practice Of Converting Civil Disputes Into Criminal Cases Rampant In Many States : Supreme Court

Date: December 16 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed concerns over the growing trend of converting civil disputes into criminal cases, emphasizing that such practices need to be strongly checked.

  • The Supreme Court bench included CJI Sanjiv Khanna and Justice Sanjay Kumar.
  • A plea was being heard regarding the quashing of criminal charges related to a property sale dispute.
  • The court noted that the complainant only filed a criminal case despite the nature of the issue being predominantly civil.
  • CJI Khanna highlighted that this practice is rampant in several states and needs to be curtailed.
  • The case will be reviewed again in March 2025.
“This is again one of those cases where a civil default/ civil case is converted into a criminal one and this has to be checked very strongly.”

item.title: ‘Can take action’: Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat tells LS on demand for Gandhi family to return Nehru’s letters - The Indian Express
item.description:
Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat Responds to Demand for Nehru Letters' Return

Publication Date: Monday, source: Indian Express

The Lok Sabha witnessed a significant discussion when Union Culture Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat acknowledged the demand for the return of letters from Jawaharlal Nehru held by Sonia Gandhi.

  • Demand for the letters’ return was raised during a question by BJP MP Sambit Patra.
  • The letters were removed in 2008 and sent to Gandhi in 51 cartons.
  • The correspondence includes important figures like Edwina Mountbatten and Babu Jagjivan Ram.
  • Shekhawat indicated that action can be taken regarding the matter.
  • Patra classified the letters as “historical heritage” and not personal property.
“What was there in the letters that the first family felt should not be made public?” - Sambit Patra

This matter has generated significant debate regarding the return of historical documents and transparency in preserving India's heritage.

item.title: ‘Helped us immensely’: Sri Lankan President Dissanayake thanks India for $5 billion economic support - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sri Lankan President Dissanayake Thanks India for $5 Billion Economic Support

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed gratitude to India for its significant economic support during Sri Lanka's financial crisis, particularly emphasizing the crucial assistance in debt restructuring.

  • Dissanayake is on his first bilateral visit to New Delhi after winning elections.
  • India has provided $5 billion in aid through credits and grants.
  • New projects announced include railway system rehabilitation and educational scholarships.
  • Dissanayake assured that Sri Lanka's territory will not be used against India's interests.
  • India plans to finalize a defense cooperation agreement with Sri Lanka soon.
“We faced an unprecedented economic crisis some 2 years ago and India supported us immensely to come out of that quagmire.” - Anura Kumara Dissanayake

This collaboration is poised to flourish, focusing on regional security, infrastructure, and various developmental projects in Sri Lanka.

item.title: Supreme Court Expresses Disinclination To Stay Karnataka Lokayukta Investigation In DK Shivakumar... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Expresses Disinclination To Stay Karnataka Lokayukta Investigation In DK Shivakumar

Publication Date: November 10, 2023 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court today showed hesitation to issue an interim order during the ongoing investigation by the Karnataka Lokayukta regarding Congress leader and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar's disproportionate assets case.

  • The Supreme Court is reviewing pleas challenging the Karnataka government's withdrawal of consent for the CBI to prosecute Shivakumar.
  • The Karnataka High Court previously dismissed petitions questioning this withdrawal, indicating it can only be adjudicated under Article 131 of the Constitution.
  • The Supreme Court will hear the case on January 22, with the Karnataka government's counter-affidavit requested.
  • The Income Tax department had made significant findings in a raid in 2017 linked to Shivakumar, leading to various legal proceedings against him.
Justice Kant remarked, 'Are we so powerless that we can't declare one proceeding annulled and allow the other to continue?'

In conclusion, the matter remains sensitive as implications for political and legal proceedings intertwine, with significant interest surrounding the outcomes.
